text: Hello there, would like to if anyone deploying with GCP? You using GKE with regional ips attached to cloud nat, am I correct?

elements.text: Hello there, would like to if anyone deploying with GCP? You using GKE with regional ips attached to cloud nat, am I correct?

text: You can have your private GKE cluster in one region, with nodes in different zones (-a/-b/-c) and exposed publicly for egress on a single static public IP on its NAT Gateway, yes

elements.text: You can have your private GKE cluster in one region, with nodes in different zones (-a/-b/-c) and exposed publicly for egress on a single static public IP on its NAT Gateway, yes

text: Yeah, good question as your sponsor is probably the one that would allow your IP the first. And the one asking the others to allow yours too

elements.text: Yeah, good question as your sponsor is probably the one that would allow your IP the first. And the one asking the others to allow yours too

text: And the onboarding secret can only be generated with clusters with that whitelisted egress ip?

elements.text: And the onboarding secret can only be generated with clusters with that whitelisted egress ip?

text: Yes, you can't contact any SV from an unauthorized IP address

elements.text: Yes, you can't contact any SV from an unauthorized IP address

text: A quick one here is if we have a global ip instead of regional, is there a way to connect to GKE or docker compose?

elements.text: A quick one here is if we have a global ip instead of regional, is there a way to connect to GKE or docker compose?

text:
Hi all, we just got VPN access and I am trying to get the QS started on DevNet. Unfortunately `splice` keeps getting stuck in the waiting state.  In the logs I keep seeing this error
```{"@timestamp":"2025-05-23T11:53:22.012Z","@version":"1","message":"Failed to export spans. Server responded with gRPC status code 2. Error message: otel-collector: Name or service not known","logger_name":"i.o.e.i.grpc.GrpcExporter","thread_name":"OkHttp <http://otel-collector:14001/>...","level":"WARN","level_value":30000}```

text:
<https://docs.dev.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_users.html>

<@U01695DQPDK> i had follow this docs to assign more than one user to the validator wallet.

```curl -X POST -H "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data-raw "{\"party_id\":\"$PARTY_ID\",\"name\":\"$USER\"}" \
https://<URL of your wallet>/api/validator/v0/admin/users```
the bearer token you can just get by looking at the wallet request in the browser console.
